snippet: The former vice president describes, for the first time and in vivid personal detail, a four-decade medical struggle that he has largely kept secret.
abstract: Former Vice Pres Dick Cheney's book Heart: An American Medical Odyssey describes, for the first time in vivid personal detail, his 35-year medical struggle with heart issues that he had kept largely private.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JULIE BOSMAN
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Julie Bosman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The former vice president describes, for the first time and in vivid personal detail, a four-decade medical struggle that he has largely kept secret.

headline.main: In New Book, Cheney Recalls 5 Heart Attacks and His Brush With Death
headline.print_headline: In New Book, Cheney Recalls 5 Heart Attacks and His Brush With Death
